faction_profile.name: 하오문 (Haomun / Lower Five Families / 下五門)
alias: Masters of the Red Light District

location.connectivity: Ubiquitous but loosely connected compared to the Beggars' Sect.

faction_profile.composition: Composed of the Five Lowly Trades (Cha, Seon, Jeom, Gak, A).

status.reputation: Despised as bottom-feeders but essential for information and illicit services.
status.rivalry: Beggars' Sect (Gaebang) - Competes for info, though Haomun is less united.

core_business: Information Trading: Processing fragmented gossip into valuable intel.
Assassination & Sabotage: Poisoning food, stabbing in sleep.
Entertainment & Vice: Prostitution, Gambling, Black Market.

tactics: Avoid fair fights. Use poison (Dok) and hidden weapons (Amgi).
Target enemies when they are eating, sleeping, or having sex.
Seduction (Saek-gong) to drain vitality or extract secrets.
combat_style.weakness: Individual combat power is low. They rely on numbers and treachery.

elite_unit.name: 암영대 (Dark Shadow Unit)
elite_unit.description: Elite assassins and spies of Haomun.
elite_unit.role: Execution of high-value targets or silencing loose tongues.

list: 무영삼식 (Shadowless Three Forms) - Simple but lethal moves.
방중술 (Bedchamber Arts) - Energy draining or mind control.

narrative_role: The 'Information Broker' the protagonist visits when the Beggars' Sect is unavailable or too righteous.
The source of 'Poisoning' incidents in inns.
A faction that uses beauty (Courtesans) to entrap powerful figures.
The 'Underdog' faction that survives by being smarter and crueler than the orthodox masters.
